intro: Peucedanum rivae, commonly known as the river angelica, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the carrot family (Apiaceae) and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, temperate environments and is often found near rivers and streams. Peucedanum rivae is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
